title: Patching failed and we're not sure why. Please restart the client to try patching again. (Error 004)
body:
I was playing league last night and everything was fine. This morning I opened up the client, after it had finished updating and I got this message! 
"Patching failed and we're not sure why. Please restart the client to try patching again. ( Error Code 004 )"
Restarting the client a number of times and also running the client repair tool had no effect.
I've had a bit of a look around and the most common solution which i could find to this problem was downloading and installing the
' Hextech Repair Tool ' which I tried but unfortunately did not work... I have no idea how to fix this, would greatly appreciate some help!
I Just want to get back to playing league!

here is an easy way on how to fix it

1- windows + R.

2- type in msconfig, press ok

3- go to boot, select safe boot and Network, press Apply then OK, and restart your computer.

4- make sure you are connected to the internet, open league of legends and patch it.

there should be no problem this way, also to get back to normal mode just do the steps again and uncheck the safe boot and restart your computer again

Hi Guys,

If any one is still facing this issue, after trying all the steps mentioned, then please try this step to see if this resolves your issue as this worked for me.

1. Open the LOL game client.
2. Click on the lever/settings icon on the top right.
3. Select the General Tab.
4. Click on the "Initiate Full Repair" button  and wait for it to complete.
5. Run the client again and this should fix your problem. 

This worked for me and I am able to login to my game client. Hope this works for you. Peace!!!

I'm having this issue now when it worked fine yesterday... tried to turn off my firewall (which is just Windows Defender) it won't fully turn off, and if I go into processes and try  to end the "Antimalware service" fully, (which is Windows Defender) it keeps saying if I stop the program my computer will be unstable and shut down... -_-

So I've had this problem since the new patch, and I haven't been able to get it to work for the longest time. However, I found the solution and maybe it'll work for you guys too. So the problem turned out to be the Antivirus, and even when its disabled, it was still interfering with the game updating. So by completely uninstalling AVG, league worked fine right after. Hope this works for you guys too :)

Please reinstall the game exactly according to my instructions:

Uninstall the game completely through the Control Panel and make sure there are no game files
Scan your computer with CCleaner
Reset your computer
Again, make sure all game files have been uninstalled
Download the installer again from our site:
Https://signup.eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/signup/redownload
Install the game in the default location
C: \ Riot Games \ League of Legends
When the installation is finished do not turn on the client just close the window
Turn off the firewall completely and uninstall the antivirus software if you have one
Reset your computer
When re-enabled, the computer launches the game client with administrator privileges
Once you've turned on the client, hover the game and click on the gear wheel in the top right corner
Disable the Peer to Peer option
Make sure you have selected the EUNE server
Now wait for the client to update

This error code can happy early on when launching the patcher, and can happen if some setting or software is blocking league from being accessed.  Depending on the player, this could be a [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) or even connection problem reaching the patching server.  

For your specific case, I suggest using the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot and get updated.  The HRT is a great tool, but doesn't fix it all.  You can use it to automatically configure your firewall settings, which is a step in that guide.  Hope that helps!
